page.title: 19A TYPICAL DAY OF THE PRIEST
page.content: There is no such thing as a typical working day in the life of a Parish Priest.If such a thing did exist it could begin perhaps at 8.30am.with saying the Office of Matins.At 9.00am. a visit to the village school for assembly followed by a Religious Education lesson.At 10.30am.back to the Vicarage to deal with correspondence,prepare sermons,pick hymns for Sunday services,write material for the Parish magazine and, if time permits,try to catch up on some reading.The afternoon would be spent mainly in visiting houses or people in hospital.In the evening there maybe wedding or other interviews plus meetings of village organisations to attend.Above all the Parish Priest has to be available to all his parishoners whenever they need him.
